data.title: FRACTURE MECHANICS OF LODE-SWARM IN THE INNER CONTACT-ZONE OF XIHUASHAN GRANITE-STOCK
data.text:
Abstract

The xihuashan tungsten mine is a large-scale veinlike deposit occurring in the inner contact zone of a granitic body.The mechanical conditions controlling the distribution pattern and the extent of lodeswarm are thoroughly studied.According to the factors affecting the lode-swarmpropagation from analysis of crack extension force, the fracture strain s.reflected the lode-swarm development, which is determined by the values of fracture density ρ and driving stress σ of the lode-swarm.By a number of measured and statistical data, it is demonstrated that the averagevalues of ρ and εc of lode-swarm at Xihuashan are very high, and then from the calculated elastic modulus of the granitic body, it is foundthat calculated values of its driving stress are also quite high.Thus it can be explained that the great increase in the degree of propagstion and the range of opening of the fracture in lode-swarm at Xihuashan mine results from sustained increase in the pressure of filling by ore-bearing solution.After estimated and calculated initial condition of propagation of lode-swarm is correlated with final strain and stress, it is found that the total strain increases in large amounts, and driving stress tends to increase during fracture propagation.This is probably the reason for increase in size of the lode-swarm.From comparision, both ratios ε0/ε0, and σ/σ0 of lode-swarm at Ward Lake district of America are smaller than l, indicating a process of static-propagation of the fractures which occur in an infinite matrix, but at Xihuashan mine, the increase in driving stress similarly with staticpropagation as main process is corresponding to the marginal condition of crack-arrest by the lithological boundary.Owing to the lithological features of Xihuashan granitic body manifesting that its elastic modulus is obviously lower than that of its wallrock, the crack extension force of lodes in the granitic body decreases when approaching the boundary surface and nearly equals to the decreasing range of crack extension force created by the stress-interference between the parallel lodes.The corresponding increase in driving stress of lodes, therefore, is allowed to obtain a new balance with extension force.It is concluded that lithological boundary is the predominant marginal-condition of generating large-scale lode-swarm in inner contactzone of granitic body.
